question: who drafted the document of the un declaration of human rights
api_result: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) was drafted by a committee within the United Nations, specifically the Commission on Human Rights. The commission was chaired by Eleanor Roosevelt, who played a significant role in the drafting process. The drafting committee included members from various countries, and René Cassin of France is often credited as the principal author of the document. The UDHR was adopted by the United Nations General Assembly on December 10, 1948.
